description: Pacific Institution Building A, Installation of Range Barriers (C, D and F)
full_summary:
-----------------------------

### Pacific Institution Building A Range Barriers C, D, and F

**Tender Reference:** WS4151771035-Doc4151796629

**Publication Date:** August 17, 2023

**Closing Date:** September 12, 2023 at 02:00 PM (EDT)

**Amendment Number:** 1, issued on September 1, 2023

**Contract Duration:** November 1, 2023 to March 15, 2024 (expectations)

### Project Overview
---

The Correctional Service of Canada / Department of Public Works and Government Services has issued an Invitation to Qualify for the construction of range barriers C, D, and F at the Pacific Institution building.

### Scope of Work
---
This construction project involves the installation, repair, or demolition of specialized building structures. The scope includes:

* Air conditioning installation, maintenance, or repair services (UNSPSC Code: 72101511)
* Specialized public building construction services (UNSPSC Code: 72121400)
* Demolition services (UNSPSC Code: 72141510)

### Location
---
The project is to be conducted in British Columbia, Canada.

### Eligibility
---
(a) Contractors must participate in the **Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)**.

(b) Contractors are invited to qualify via the electronic tendering application on the website **Discovery (TPS-GC).**

### Contracting Entity
---
* Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada
* Contact: Simon Leung (simon.leung@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Tender Process
---

(A) Tender submissions must be submitted electronically through the above-mentioned website before the closing date.

(B) Late and or incomplete bids will not be considered.

(C) The lowest-priced bid will be selected as the winner.

### Download
---

* The Invitation to Qualify and the relevant documents can be downloaded from the Discovery website.

### Queries
---
For more information, you may contact the contracting entity Team above. Failure to which they will not be responded to. Anglo francophone bilingual mandatory.
